get.description: Get a count of issues by status, matching the provided filters

parameters.name: category
parameters.description: Issue category

parameters.name: scope[type]
parameters.description: Scope of issues to view / update

parameters.name: scope[id]
parameters.description: Project or release group ID (required when scope[type] is "project" or "releaseGroup")

parameters.name: scope[revision]
parameters.description: Revision ID (when scope[type] is "project")

parameters.name: scope[revisionScanId]
parameters.description: Revision scan ID (when scope[type] is "project")

parameters.name: scope[release]
parameters.description: Release group ID (when scope[type] is "releaseGroup")

parameters.name: scope[releaseScanId]
parameters.description: Release scan ID (when scope[type] is "releaseGroup")

parameters.name: scope[compareTo][revision]
parameters.description: The revision ID to compare issues with. Only availabe for Project Scope.

parameters.name: scope[compareTo][changeStatus]
parameters.description: The status of issues to fetch when comparing issues. - New issues are present in the current revision but not in the comparison revision. - Remediated issues are present in the comparison revision but not in the current revision. - Unchanged issues are present in both revisions. Only available for Project Scope.

parameters.name: ids[]
parameters.description: Filter by specific issue IDs

parameters.name: filter[revisionIds][]
parameters.description: Filter by specific revision IDs

parameters.name: filter[search]
parameters.description: Filter by package name or CVE (when category is "vulnerability")

parameters.name: filter[depths][]
parameters.description: Filter by issue depth

parameters.name: filter[ticketed][]
parameters.description: Filter by ticketed status.  Only available to premium users.

parameters.name: filter[containerLayers][]
parameters.description: Filter by container layer

parameters.name: filter[type][]
parameters.description: Filter by licensing issue type (when category is "licensing") or quality issue type (when category is "quality")

parameters.name: filter[packageManagers][]
parameters.description: Filter by specific package managers

parameters.name: filter[projectLabels][]
parameters.description: Filter by specific project labels

parameters.name: filter[identification][]
parameters.description: Filter by license identification (when category is "licensing")

parameters.name: filter[severity][]
parameters.description: Filter by vuln severity (when category is "vulnerability")

parameters.name: filter[foundAfter]
parameters.description: Include only issues found on after a given date.  Only available to premium users

parameters.name: filter[hasFix][]
parameters.description: Filter by vuln fixability (when category is "vulnerability")

parameters.name: filter[upgradeDistance][]
parameters.description: Filter by vuln upgrade distance (when category is "vulnerability")

parameters.name: filter[exploitMaturity][]
parameters.description: Filter by vuln exploit maturity (when category is "vulnerability")

parameters.name: filter[ignoreReason][]
parameters.description: Filter by vuln ignore reason (when category is "vulnerability") This value appears in the vulnerabilities.analysis.detail field in CycloneDX SBOM reports

items.description: Provided reason for ignoring or resolving a security issue. 'Fixed' and 'Under_investigation' map to VEX statuses with the same names. All other values map to the VEX status 'Not Affected'. This value appears in the vulnerabilities.analysis.justification field of CycloneDX SBOM reports.

parameters.name: filter[licenses][]
parameters.description: Filter by issues affected by a set of license ID's (when category is "licensing")

200.description: Number of matching issues and revisions

202.description: Empty results with a message indicating the scoped project's build status

Optional array of direct dependency origin paths, only present
when includeDirectDependencyOriginPaths=true is supplied as a URL param.

firstFoundAt.description: The date when the issue was first found for this project or release group.

defaultBranch.description: The default branch of the project.

latest.description: Whether this issue is present in the most recent scan of the project. If false, the issue may be considered remediated.

revisionId.description: The ID of the revision that is affected by this issue.

revisionScanId.description: The ID of the revision scan associated with this issue.

cvssVector.description: The CVSS Vector for the vuln. Prefers the V3 vector if it exists, and falls back to the V2 vector. Is null if neither vector exists.

parameters.description: Filter packages to those from the specified fetchers.  For example, fetchers[0]=npm&fetchers[1]=apk will match all NPM packages and all APK packages.

parameters.description: Filter results to only packages with the specified name.  Supports partial matches.  For example "foo" will match "foo", "foobar", and "foo-bar".

parameters.description: Filter results to only include packages which are direct or transitive dependencies of your projects.

parameters.description: Filter packages to those belonging to your projects with the specified labels.

parameters.description: Filter packages to only one of your specific projects.  Exact match only.

parameters.description: Filter results to your projects which are public or private

parameters.description: Filter packages to include only packages that do or do not have packages as dependencies which are blocked by your organization

parameters.description: Filter packages to those with vulnerabilities that have specific Common Vulnerabilities and Exposures (CVE) identifiers

parameters.name: cwes
parameters.description: Filter packages to those with vulnerabilities that have specific Common Weakness Enumeration (CWE) identifiers

parameters.name: locators
parameters.description: Filter packages to those with specific package locators (exact match only)

parameters.description: Filter packages to those with vulnerabilities that either have or do not have a fix available

parameters.description: Filter packages by severity levels of issues
